intro: Dendrobium purpureogriseum, commonly known as the purple-gray dendrobium, is an epiphytic orchid native to Southeast Asia. It features long, cane-like stems that store water and nutrients, typical of its orchid family. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of purple and gray, often appearing in clusters. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture. It thrives in warm, humid environments with bright indirect light.
